I see people complain about labor inefficiencies and one even claiming to be economist, I seriously doubt that.
First, as evident by page 8-10, there are those who still have a job. I would conjecture that those who are more compliant still can hold jobs.
Second, I think people have a misunderstanding on what the current labor market distribution is. As production increasingly shift toward mechanization and automation, less and less people are working in actual production jobs while more and more are working in service industry, including entertainment. Half the work force is more than sufficient for maintaining production. In fact, per a quick search, currently in the US only 1.36% are in agriculture, 19.91% are in industry and 78.74% are in services. Some services like medical are essential, but many aren't, so half is enough to meet needs. In any case, the females are still "working" in the entertainment industry.
If you wanna talk about feasibility, at least look into it.

I don't get the, "It's just fictional don't get upset over something that's fake," argument. Like I get not getting too hung up on it but if I feel genuine rage towards say Malty from Shield Hero for being a bitch and disgust towards how Naofumi was treated am I still being ridiculous? You're supposed to apply some morality to empathize with Naofumi's plight and hate Malty to enjoy the theme. Why does hentai get a pass from this? It's basically a tradegy and most people despise that stuff and when sex is involved it just gets sadder. I can't count how many times I've read other artists take on Romeo and Juliet and seen them change the ending where they get a happy ending instead or at least Romeo dies only. People hate sad endings and always will. Hentai isn't absolved from this.
